intro: Osbeckia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian willow, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and succulent stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Osbeckia abyssinica is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to semi-arid environments.
